title: How to Type With Your Mouse

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Press Win + I or click the Windows logo to open the Start menu and click the gear icon.

steps.title: Click Ease of Access.
steps.content: Click Ease of Access . It's next to a dashed line clock icon.

steps.title: Click Keyboard.
steps.content: Click Keyboard . You'll see it in the panel on the left under "Interaction."

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Use the On-Screen Keyboard" to turn it on .
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Use the On-Screen Keyboard" to turn it on . Press Win + Ctrl + O to turn the on-screen keyboard off and on. Click the Options key to change the keyboard's options.

steps.title: Swipe from the right side of your screen and tap search (if you're in tablet mode).
steps.content: Swipe from the right side of your screen and tap search (if you're in tablet mode). If you have a mouse, skip this step.

steps.title: Click the Search icon .
steps.content: Click the Search icon . It's in the Charms bar that you'll see by moving your mouse to the right side of your screen.

steps.title: Search "On-Screen Keyboard.
steps.content: Search "On-Screen Keyboard. " As you type, you'll see search results appear.

steps.title: Click "On-Screen Keyboard.
steps.content: Click "On-Screen Keyboard. " The keyboard will remain on your screen until you close it. Click the Options key to change the keyboard's options.

steps.title: Click the Start icon .
steps.content: Click the Start icon . You'll see it in the lower left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Click All Programs.
steps.content: Click All Programs . It's above the Start menu icon in the menu that opens.

steps.title: Click Accessories.
steps.content: Click Accessories . Clicking this will give you a list of programs and folders.

steps.title: Click Ease of Access.
steps.content: Click Ease of Access . This is a folder that's listed below the programs.

steps.title: Click On-Screen Keyboard.
steps.content: Click On-Screen Keyboard . A keyboard will appear on your screen and stay there until you close it. Click the Options key to change the keyboard's options. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open System Preferences.
steps.content: Open System Preferences. You can do this by clicking the apple logo and then System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Accessibility.
steps.content: Click Accessibility . It's next to an icon that looks like a person inside a blue circle.

steps.title: Click Keyboard.
steps.content: Click Keyboard . You'll see this in the panel on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click to check the box next to "Enable Accessibility Keyboard.
steps.content: Click to check the box next to "Enable Accessibility Keyboard. " The keyboard on your screen will remain until you close it. [2] X Research source
